block.p: Debt * American Annuity Group Inc., Cincinnati, is offering $100 million of senior notes due in 2001 at 100 to yield 9.5 percent through Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette. Callable in four years, the notes are rated Ba-3 by Moody's Investors Service, B+ by Standard & Poor's and BB- by Duff & Phelps.

* Chemical Banking Corp., New York, is offering $150 million of 6.7 percent subordinated notes due in 2008 at 99.737 to yield 6.728 percent through Morgan Stanley. The noncallable notes are rated A-3 by Moody's and A by S.& P. and Duff & Phelps.

Debt * American Annuity Group Inc., Cincinnati, is offering $100 million of senior notes due in 2001 at 100 to yield 9.5 percent through Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette. Callable in four years, the notes are rated Ba-3 by Moody's Investors Service, B+ by Standard & Poor's and BB- by Duff & Phelps.

* Chemical Banking Corp., New York, is offering $150 million of 6.7 percent subordinated notes due in 2008 at 99.737 to yield 6.728 percent through Morgan Stanley. The noncallable notes are rated A-3 by Moody's and A by S.& P. and Duff & Phelps.

* Chrysler Financial Corp., Southfield, Mich., is offering $300 million of 6.625 percent notes due in 2000 at 99.775 percent to yield 6.666 percent through Salomon Brothers. The noncallable notes are rated Ba-1 by Moody's, BB+ by S.& P. and BBB by Duff & Phelps.
* Federal Home Loan Bank is offering $200 milion of step-up notes due in 1998 at 100 to yield 4.5 percent through Nomura Securities. The issue is noncallable for two years.
* Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. is offering $250 million of step-up notes due in 1996 at 100 to yield 3.9 percent through Goldman, Sachs. The notes are noncallable for one year.

* Leucadia National Corp., New York, is offering $100 million of 7.75 percent senior notes due in 2013 at 99 to yield 7.85 percent through Jefferies & Co. The noncallable notes are rated Baa-3 by Moody's, BBB by S.& P. and BBB- by Duff & Phelps.

* Wisconsin Bell Telephone Co., Milwaukee, a unit of Ameritech Corp., is offering $150 million of 6.75 percent debentures due in 2024 at 97.591 to yield 6.94 percent through First Boston. Noncallable for 10 years, the issue is rated AAA by Moody's and S.& P. and AA+ by Duff & Phelps.
